description: President Donald Trump’s aides and allies are discussing the possibility of making Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent the top White House economic adviser, in addition to his current job, should the president pick Kevin Hassett as the next chair of the Federal Reserve, according to people familiar with the matter. Joe Mathieu and Amara Omeokwe have more on "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Bessent May Be Tapped to Lead National Economic Council

description: On today's episode of Bloomberg Businessweek Daily, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec discuss how today's ADP report adds to more evidence of a US labor market slowdown, plus earnings results from Macy's and Dollar Tree. Bloomberg's Stuart Paul and Emily Cohn join the show to discuss. Plus, LendingClub CEO Scott Sanborn discusses the state of US consumer credit and the company's push into home improvement financing, Bloomberg's Keith Naughton discusses President Trump's plan to unwind Biden-era car mileage mandates. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Stocks Higher on Fed Cut Bets | Bloomberg Businessweek Daily 12/03/2025

description: US companies shed payrolls in November by the most since early 2023, adding to concerns about a more pronounced weakening in the labor market. Private-sector payrolls decreased by 32,000, according to ADP Research data released Wednesday. Payrolls have now fallen four times in the last six months. The median estimate in a Bloomberg survey of economists called for a 10,000 gain. Meanwhile, consumer spending is painting a cautious picture as Macy's sees soft demand from low-income shoppers this quarter and Dollar Tree raises its full-year earnings outlook, a sign the discount retailer is capturing more spending from stretched shoppers. Bloomberg Economics US and Canada Economist Stuart Paul and Bloomberg News Consumer Team Leader Emily Cohn join Bloomberg Businessweek Daily to discuss. They speak with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: ADP: Payrolls at US Companies Fall by Most Since 2023

description: LendingClub CEO Scott Sanborn discusses the company's customer base, the state of the US credit market and current credit card rates. He speaks with Tim Stenovec, Carol Massar and Herman Chan on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily.' (Source: Bloomberg)
title: LendingClub's Sanborn on the State of Consumer Credit

author: Nancy Cook, Josh Wingrove
description: Donald Trump’s aides and allies are discussing the possibility of making Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent the top White House economic adviser — in addition to his current job — should the president pick Kevin Hassett as the next chair of the Federal Reserve, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Bessent Under Discussion to Also Lead National Economic Council

description: Bloomberg News Auto Reporter Keith Naughton joins Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to discuss the auto industry's reaction to President Donald Trump easing mileage rules, saying that auto makers are saving billions of dollars since they no longer face penalties for failing to meet fuel economy standards.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump to Ease Mileage Rules in Bid to Curb Car Prices

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: The US Food and Drug Administration’s new vaccine approval philosophy upends established regulatory practices and could put the health and safety of Americans at risk, according to an article written by a dozen of the agency’s former leaders.
title: Former FDA Commissioners Raise Alarm Over New Vaccine Policy

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump said a meeting between his envoy Steve Witkoff and Russian President Vladimir Putin was “reasonably good” but acknowledged he doesn’t know what the outcome will be after successive rounds of talks over a deal to end the fighting in Ukraine.
title: Trump Calls Witkoff’s Meeting With Putin ‘Reasonably Good’

author: Joe Sobczyk
description: The report comes as Congress is examining strikes on alleged drug boats.
title: Pentagon Watchdog Report Intensifies Scrutiny of Hegseth

description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Washington Correspondent Joe Mathieu discusses continued White House defense of the Pentagon's handling of an attack on an alleged drug-running boat. On today's show, Former Ranking Member of the House Intelligence Committee Jane Harman, Stonecourt Capital Partner Rick Davis, Third Way Senior Fellow Caitlin Legacki, Former Republican Congressman Kevin Brady, former Mexican Chief Negotiator for USMCA Ken Smith Ramos and former Special Advisor for Trade Policy to Canada’s Deputy Minister of Finance Steve Verheul.   (Source: Bloomberg)
title: White House Backs Hegseth Amid Strikes | Balance of Power 12/03/2025

author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: The Democratic Republic of Congo aims to sign a minerals and infrastructure partnership with the Trump administration on Thursday as part of a series of deals targeted at ending a long-running conflict in the eastern part of the resource-rich African nation.
title: US, Congo Eye Minerals Pact Amid Push for Peace Deal with Rwanda

description: President Donald Trump unveils a plan to relax Biden-era fuel efficiency standards. He calls them expensive and burdensome. “Today my administration is taking historic action to lower costs for American consumers, protect American auto jobs and make buying a car much more affordable for countless American families — and also safer,” Trump said in an Oval Office event Wednesday with representatives from Detroit’s major automakers. The old rules said vehicles needed a fuel economy of 50 miles per gallon by the year 2031. Trump's rules cut that number to 34.5 mpg. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Unwinds Biden-Era Rules for Gas Mileage

author: Miranda Davis
description: Mike Lindell, the businessman who founded My Pillow Inc. before becoming an outspoken ally of President Donald Trump, filed paperwork on Wednesday to run for governor of Minnesota in next year’s election.
title: MyPillow CEO Is 98% Sure He’s Running for Minnesota Governor

description: Republican Matt Van Epps wins a special election in Tennessee and will take over a coveted US House seat. The Trump-backed Republican candidate led by about nine points with more than 95% of the vote counted. But Democrats made a strong showing in the district that Trump won in 2024 by roughly 22 percentage points.  Out political panel discusses the results on "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Republican Van Epps Wins Close Tennessee US House Race

author: Peter Blumberg
description: President Donald Trump continues to expand troop deployments to US cities, escalating a campaign to assert military power at home with little precedent in US history.
title: What’s at Stake as Trump Expands the Use of Troops at Home

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump is unveiling his administration’s plan to relax stringent Biden-era fuel efficiency standards, with the administration casting the change as a way to lower consumer costs.
title: Trump Outlines Plan to Unwind Biden-Era Car Mileage Mandates

author: Antonia Mufarech
description: Chile’s leftist presidential candidate Jeannette Jara met with US head of state Donald Trump’s ambassador to the Latin American nation, the diplomat said on Wednesday following tensions between both nations.
title: Trump’s Chile Ambassador Met With Leftist Presidential Candidate Jeannette Jara

description:
Jane Harman, Former Democratic Congresswoman from California and former Ranking Member of the House Intelligence Committee says she would be "raising hell" over the Venezuela strikes and Congress is "on trial."
Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said he wasn’t watching when a top US admiral ordered a second strike on an alleged drug-running boat on Sept. 2, further distancing himself from an attack that has drawn bipartisan scrutiny and prompted accusations of possible war crimes.
Speaking at a Cabinet meeting alongside President Donald Trump, Hegseth said he watched the first strike live but then had other meetings to attend and only learned of the full sequence of events a “couple of hours later.” He voiced support for Admiral Frank Bradley, the commander who ordered the second strike, calling his decisions the right call “to ultimately sink the boat and eliminate the threat.”  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Hegseth Denies Watching Second Sept. 2 Strike

author: Jen Judson
description: Lockheed Martin Corp. has opened a new lab focused on hypersonic weapons in Alabama, as the US struggles to catch up with China and Russia in deploying the advanced technology.
title: Lockheed Opens Hypersonic Lab as US Races to Deploy Key Weapon

author: Marcelo Rochabrun
description: Brookfield Asset Management will cease operating a series of troubled roads in Peru’s capital city at the end of Wednesday, after running out of cash due to court orders that suspended collection of toll payments.
title: Brookfield to Cease Operating Troubled Peru Toll Roads on Wednesday

description: The situation in Venezuela isn’t about being macho or lethal. The secretary of “war” doesn’t understand that, Bloomberg Opinion columnist Andreas Kluth explains. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Hegseth Doesn't Understand the Stakes in Venezuela

author: Mathieu Dion
description: Separatists in Quebec have never been to able win enough support to achieve their goal of turning Canada’s second-most populous province into its own country. Yet their dream of independence endures. Now, with the separatist Parti Quebecois leading in public opinion polls in the province and promising a new referendum on secession if it prevails in elections next October, the topic is back on the table. That’s been enough to start worrying some bond investors.
title: Why Bond Investors Worry Anew About Quebec Separatism

author: Katy O'Donnell
description: Senate Democrats are warning the Trump administration not to cut an arcane but critical function of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau that underpins the housing market as officials move to dismantle the agency.
title: Warren Warns CFPB on Its ‘Half-Baked Idea’ for Mortgage-Rate Data

author: Daniel Flatley, Yian Lee
description: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said that the US is expecting a large investment pledge from Taiwan in trade talks, while the self-governing island’s president, Lai Ching-te, listed areas that need improvement in order for projects to be completed.
title: Lutnick Eyes Big Taiwan Investment, Lai Hints at Some Issues

author: Roxana Tiron, Courtney McBride
description: The Pentagon is deploying an attack drone that’s based on an Iranian model used against American and allied forces overseas, a tacit recognition of how the US defense sector has lagged in developing cheap technology mastered by cash-strapped adversaries.
title: US Deploys Cheap Attack Drone Copied From Iranian Technology

author: Chris Strohm
description: Former Justice Department Special Counsel Jack Smith has been subpoenaed to testify before the Republican-controlled House Judiciary Committee in two weeks about his sweeping investigations into President Donald Trump’s actions.
title: House Republicans Subpoena Special Counsel Who Probed Trump

description: Bitcoin extended a tentative rebound on Wednesday, climbing to a two-week high as traders look for signs that the wider crypto market may be regaining its footing after a prolonged selloff. Bloomberg's Mike McGlone joins to discuss with Paul Sweeney and Norah Mulinda. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Bitcoin Hits Two-Week High in Cautious Crypto Market Recovery

author: Oscar Medina
description: The head of financial regulation at Colombia’s finance ministry, Monica Higuera, has quit, citing differences of opinion with the government.
title: Regulator Quits as Colombia Pressures Pensions to Invest Locally

author: Patrick Howell O'Neill
description: The Trump administration is ending a pay incentive program intended to hire and retain experts in the federal government’s primary civilian cybersecurity agency, which has already been depleted by firings, resignations and reassignments.
title: US Cyber Agency Cuts Incentive Pay Program for Diminished Staff

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: The Pentagon’s acting inspector general has turned over the results of its long-anticipated probe into whether Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth violated secrecy rules by sharing attack plans on the Signal messaging app, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Pentagon Watchdog Gives ‘Signalgate’ Report on Hegseth to Senate

author: Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump pardoned US Representative Henry Cuellar and his wife of federal corruption charges, a gesture to a Texas Democrat often at odds with his own party on key issues.
title: Trump Pardons Texas Democrat, Wife Who Faced Bribery Charges

author: Albertina Torsoli
description: France is asking the European Union to adopt rules that require carmakers to assemble electric vehicles in the region, as nations continue to put forward different proposals in the bloc’s review on CO2 fleet emissions.
title: France Pushes EU to Support Local Production in Auto Relief Deal

description: Goldman Sachs Chief FX and EM Strategist Kamakshya Trivedi says the US dollar does not deserve its "very rich valuation." He explains on Bloomberg Brief. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Dollar Does Not Deserve Its 'Very Rich Valuation,' Goldman Strategist Says

author: Max Ramsay
description: The European Commission added Russia to its list of high-risk jurisdictions for money laundering and terrorist financing in a further financial fallout for the country almost four years after its full-scale invasion of Ukraine.
title: European Commission Adds Russia to Money Laundering High-Risk List

description:
The Kremlin says talks with a US delegation led by US envoys Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner were "constructive," but no deal was made to end the war with Ukraine. They spoke for five hours with Vladimir Putin, but some sticking points still remain. Bloomberg's Oliver Crook reports from Brussels.
Andrew Bishop of Sigmum Global then says Russia will keep looking to get more concessions from the US, Ukraine and Europe. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Kremlin Says Russia-US Talks on Ukraine Were 'Constructive'

description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday signed a law that strengthens ties with Taiwan. It requires the State Department to review how the country engages with Taiwan. China says any Taiwan issue should be handled with caution. Bloomberg's Samson Ellis reports.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Signs Bill to Strengthen Ties With Taiwan

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: NATO needs to increase its presence on the European eastern flank despite Russia’s renewed push to constrain the military alliance during peace talks with the US, according to Romania’s foreign minister.
title: Romania’s Top Diplomat Says Eastern Flank Needs More NATO Assets

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth reiterated his opposition to Navy plans to develop its next-generation F/A-XX fighter jet, arguing it will overlap with plans for a different aircraft that has President Donald Trump’s blessing.
title: Hegseth Stands Firm With Opposition to Next-Gen Navy Fighter Jet

author: Fernando Travaglini
description: Tensions between President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s government and Congress continued to escalate Tuesday, when Senate leader Davi Alcolumbre canceled a hearing for Supreme Court nominee Jorge Messias.
title: Lula and Senate Tensions Continue Over Court Pick

author: Zoe Schneeweiss, Alexander Weber
description: Christine Lagarde said the European Central Bank won’t violate European Union rules to backstop a loan to Ukraine backed by frozen Russian assets.
title: Lagarde Says ECB Won’t Violate EU Treaty Over Russian Assets

author: Myles Miller
description: Federal agents have started an immigration enforcement operation in New Orleans, as President Donald Trump’s crackdown expands to Democratic-led cities in red states.
title: New Orleans Becomes Newest Target of Trump Immigration Crackdown

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Chile’s leftist presidential candidate Jeannette Jara berated the conservative front-runner over his proposed public spending cuts in their most intense debate yet, saying the plans lack details and pose a threat to society.
title: Chile’s Kast Comes Under Fire for Spending Plans in Tense Debate

author: Vinicius Andrade, Cristiane Lucchesi, Nicolle Yapur
description: Argentine officials are starting to prepare the country’s return to international bond markets. Their hope is that markets keep moving in their favor so they can sell the bonds by the start of next year, according to people familiar with the matter who asked not to be identified because the discussions are private.
title: Serial-Defaulter Argentina Preps Return to Foreign Bond Market

author: Manuela Tobias
description: President Javier Milei confirmed late Tuesday his party became the biggest group in the lower house of Argentina’s Congress as the libertarian continues to add lawmakers while others deflect from rival blocs.
title: Milei’s Libertarian Party Becomes Top Bloc in Argentina’s Congress

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: Italy’s foreign minister said it would be “premature” for his country to participate in a NATO program to buy US weapons for Ukraine in light of ongoing peace negotiations.
title: Italy Slams Brakes on NATO Program to Buy US Weapons for Ukraine

author: Andrea Palasciano, Jorge Valero, Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union proposed two options to refill Ukraine’s war-strained budget, suggesting either a loan backed by frozen Russian assets or one backed by the bloc’s own budget.
title: EU Proposes New Plan to Use Russian Assets to Fund Ukraine

author: Jorge Valero
description: The European Union unveiled a new plan to make sure its industries aren’t overtaken by global rivals as competition intensifies with the US and China.
title: EU Boosts Economic Security Plans as US and China Tensions Rise

author: Mirette Magdy
description: Saudi Arabia is open to canceling some projects in its Vision 2030 program, the kingdom’s finance minister said, in some of the strongest public comments yet on the kingdom’s willingness to backtrack on costly developments.
title: Saudi Arabia Not Afraid to Cancel Costly Vision 2030 Projects

description: National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett says President Donald Trump's trade negotiations with other countries are an "ongoing process." Hassett also says tariffs have not caused a recession. He appears on this week's episode of "The David Rubenstein Show: Peer to Peer Conversations." This was recorded November 12 at the Economic Club of Washington DC. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trade Negotiations Are 'Ongoing Process,' Hassett Says

author: James Woolcock, Jack Sidders
description: The head of Britain’s Financial Conduct Authority said the regulator is looking at the report into the accidental early release of Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ budget.
title: UK Regulator Is Looking at Report Into Early Budget Disclosure

author: Dana Khraiche
description: Lebanon and Israel sent negotiators to join a rare summit to address tensions surrounding last year’s ceasefire with Hezbollah, following fears that the militant group is attempting to rearm.
title: Israel and Lebanon Take Part in Rare Talks in Bid to Ease Tensions

author: Alessandra Migliaccio
description: The European Central Bank has asked Italy to review its push to declare the country’s gold reserves the property of the Italian people, a move that could ultimately lead to the government selling parts of its stash.
title: ECB Asks Italian Government to Reconsider Gold-Reserves Proposal

author: Natasha Voase
description: The City of London Corporation has identified a site in Newham’s Royal Docks as its preferred option for a relocation of the UK capital’s historic markets.
title: City of London Eyes Royal Docks Site for Historic Markets

author: Charles Gorrivan, Rachel Cohrs Zhang, Gerry Smith
description: Two Republican lawmakers were invited to attend a Food and Drug Administration meeting about the potential expanded approval of a drug backed by billionaire Patrick Soon-Shiong, but the plan was scrapped due to internal opposition at the agency.
title: Lawmakers Invited to FDA Meeting for Patrick Soon-Shiong’s Drug

author: Anthony Halpin
description: The Russian president may be pleased at the slow pace of progress on ending his war.
title: Putin Plays a Long Game With Trump on Ukraine

author: Andreo Calonzo
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. announced an increase in soldiers’ salary, months after his military chief revealed attempts to unseat him.
title: Philippines’ Marcos to Bump Up Military Pay After Coup Calls

author: Alex Wickham
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer is planning to visit Beijing and Shanghai in the new year as the UK attempts to improve diplomatic ties with China after years of strained relations.
title: UK’s Starmer Plans January Trip to China in Bid to Mend Ties

author: Will Standring
description: Reform UK leader Nigel Farage dismissed reports that he’s lining up an election pact with the Conservatives, vowing instead to eliminate Britain’s main opposition party as an electoral force.
title: Farage Denies Tory Pact Reports Amid Fears He Can’t Win Majority

author: Ania Nussbaum
description: French President Emmanuel Macron will lobby his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, this week to try to avert tariffs on dairy and pork exports to China.
title: Macron to Press Xi on Protecting French Dairy Exports to China

description:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. And we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

Today's guests: Sven Kruck, Co-CEO of Quantum Systems, Latvian Foreign Minister, Baiba Braže & Peter Specht, General Partner at Creandum. 

CORRECT: In our reporting of the BMW CEO pressing the European Union to formally adopt a trade deal with the US our on-air graphic said 'BMW CEO PRESSER EU TO RATIFY US DEAL.' It should have said 'BMW CEO PRESSES EU TO RATIFY US DEAL.' (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US-Russia Discuss Ukraine Peace & Xi Courts Macron | Daybreak Europe 12/3/2025

author: Andrea Palasciano, Katharina Rosskopf
description: Belgium dismissed the European Union’s legal proposal to tap frozen Russian assets to back a loan for Ukraine.
title: Belgium Rejects EU Proposal to Tap Russian Funds for Ukraine Aid

author: Selcan Hacaoglu
description: Turkey is considering reopening its land border with Armenia in the next six months, according to people familiar with the matter, doing away with Europe’s last closed frontier of the Cold War-era and paving the way to revived trade in the Caucasus.
title: Turkey Weighs Opening Armenia Border That’s Shut Since the 90s

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: A Japanese labor union group will push in annual negotiations for a salary hike that exceeds the record gain obtained in the previous round of talks, in the latest sign that pay momentum is holding up.
title: Japan Metal Union Aims for Record Wage Hike as BOJ Watches Trend

author: Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth
description: Norway’s ruling Labor Party and its four smaller political partners reached a budget agreement, averting a government crisis.
title: Norway’s Parties Reach Budget Deal, Averting Cabinet Crisis

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin held “very useful” talks with US envoys Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, though they failed to reach an agreement on a plan to end the war in Ukraine, according to the Kremlin. Russia received four documents from the US in addition to the original peace proposal and both sides expressed willingness to continue working, Kremlin foreign policy aide Yuri Ushakov said. Bloomberg’s Greg Sullivan reports.
title: Russia-US Talks ‘Constructive,’ But Yield No Agreement

author: Galit Altstein
description: Israel will complete the handover of the Arrow 3 anti-ballistic missile defense system to Germany on Wednesday, marking the first time another country will have independent access to the high-end military asset.
title: Israel to Close $4.2 Billion Missile-Defense Deal With Germany

author: Eric Martin
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio cast doubt on the possibility that the US could negotiate a deal with Nicolas Maduro to get him to stop drug traffickers, saying the Venezuelan leader has repeatedly broken commitments over the years.
title: Rubio Casts Doubt on Maduro’s Ability to Honor Any Deal with US

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: A senior Japanese national security official confirmed with a French foreign policy adviser that both nations would cooperate toward realizing a free and open Indo-Pacific, ahead of Emmanuel Macron’s visit to China, according to Japanese media reports.
title: Japan, France Officials Confirm Policy Cooperation, Reports Say

author: Alicia Diaz
description: Republicans averted an upset in a Tennessee-based US House race Tuesday, a relief to President Donald Trump and his congressional allies.
title: GOP’s Narrow Win in Tennessee Vote Highlights Midterm Risk

author: Philip Heijmans
description: China has upgraded surveillance and electronic warfare systems across several occupied reefs in the disputed South China Sea as it seeks to strengthen its defenses and expand intelligence capabilities, a new report shows.
title: China Boosts Intelligence Reach in South China Sea, Report Says

author: Cat Barton, Soo-Hyang Choi
description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung said regular joint military drills with the US could be reviewed in order to facilitate dialogue with North Korea, in his latest olive branch to Pyongyang as he seeks to reduce tensions with the nuclear-armed neighbor.
title: South Korea Says US Drills Can Be Reviewed for North Korea Talks

author: Nacha Cattan
description: Jersey City Council Member James Solomon won the race for mayor, beating former Governor James McGreevey, who sought to return to public office more than 20 years after resigning following revelations of an extramarital affair with a male aide.
title: Solomon Defeats Former Governor McGreevey in Jersey City Runoff

author: Colum Murphy
description: China condemned the UK for again delaying a decision on whether it can open a new embassy in London, escalating a dispute just before Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s expected visit next month.
title: China ‘Strongly Deplores’ Second UK Delay on Embassy Decision

author: Stephen Stapczynski
description: The European Union has reached a deal to phase out Russian natural gas by 2027, the latest move to ratchet up pressure on Moscow over its invasion of Ukraine.
title: EU Finalizes Deal to Phase Out Russian Gas Imports by 2027

description: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Senator Rand Paul (R-KY) says Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has to take responsibility for the second strike that was ordered on a boat on Sept. 2. Constitutional Accountability Center President Elizabeth Wydra discusses if the second strike on a boat on September 2 suggests war crimes. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Senators to Question Admiral Bradley Over Second Strike | Balance of Power: Late Edition 12/02/2025

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: President Vladimir Putin is set to visit India this week for the first time since Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, a rare trip that underscores the countries’ defense and energy ties as New Delhi seeks to finalize a trade deal with Washington.
title: Putin’s India Visit Tests New Delhi’s US–Russia Balancing Act
